Description: Large sherd of an East Greek pottery plate with a flat rim and low ring base, hard buff - light brown clay, undecorated but with a well-polished surface inside and outside; incised letters ΙΔ outside below rim.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Compare the similar plate British Museum 1886,0401.671, inscribed on the rim, and the more elaborate plate British Museum 1888,0601.608.a-c. The inscribed foot fragment British Museum 1886,0401.924 probably belongs to the same group.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GO.533)
